events.title: First Earth Day is celebrated
events.description: The first Earth Day, a global environmental event, is celebrated to raise awareness about environmental protection and promote conservation efforts worldwide.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of the modern environmental movement and increased public awareness of environmental issues.

events.title: Pedro Álvares Cabral discovers Brazil
events.description: Portuguese navigator Pedro Álvares Cabral officially discovers Brazil on his voyage to India, claiming the land for Portugal.
events.significance: Initiated Portuguese colonization in South America, shaping Brazilian history and culture.

events.title: Launch of Apollo 16
events.description: NASA launches the Apollo 16 mission to the Moon, the fifth manned mission to land there, with astronauts conducting valuable lunar exploration.
events.significance: Provided important scientific data about the Moon and advanced human space travel.

events.title: Second Battle of Ypres begins
events.description: The Second Battle of Ypres during World War I begins, notable for the first large-scale use of poison gas by German forces.
events.significance: Marked a new and devastating form of chemical warfare and influenced future military tactics and warfare ethics.

events.title: Birth of Earth Day founder Gaylord Nelson
events.description: Gaylord Nelson, the founder of Earth Day and a prominent environmentalist and U.S. Senator, is honored for his contributions.
events.significance: His vision led to the establishment of Earth Day, catalyzing environmental activism worldwide.
